subject: Re: [junit] Custom MethodSorter
msgSnippet: Question: why do you want your own method sorter? As Matthew mentioned in his StackOverflow response, it s best to make test methods not dependent on each
messageBody:
Question: why do you want your own method sorter? As Matthew mentioned in
his StackOverflow response, it's best to make test methods not dependent on
each other

-- Kevin

On Wed, Dec 5, 2012 at 4:27 AM, Eirik Lygre <eirik.lygre@...> wrote:

> **
>
>
> I'm looking at creating my own MethodSorter. Is there documentation on how
> to do that, and is it even possible?
>
> --
> Eirik
>
> There is no high like a tango high
> There is no low like a tango low
>
